Comments_List: I got much more experienced in reviewing literature, and my actual research methods taught me how to find interesting information in disparate data while dealing with obstacles along the way.
I learned how to research and present my findings in a clear and concise manner. I also learned the importance of teamwork in research.
I learned how to write a 40 page paper, and how to keep it organized and (hopefully) worth reading.

Strengths - great group of faculty leading the colloquium, series of deadlines helped keep me on top of everything, dinners were a great idea

Weaknesses - it wouldve been nice to be a little more aware of how the seminar portion of the colloquium would be structured. It started off very demanding and ended up not being a thing at all, which is fine except that I had no idea thats how it was going to go.

It was nice that we met more informally this semester. This was really great for getting work done. I think the dinners would be better on another evening, as many people could not make it sometimes due to society.
The early deadline is goodwould be better to get more feedback/guidance on drafts
Definitely do the full year if you can, even if youre double majoring.
You have to take it, but the senior colloquium was one of the best parts of the EVST major.
It's not really a course - you'll take it if you need to do your thesis.
